result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian M Heydn

defendant.name: Heydn, Adrian M
defendant.address: 5518 North County Road M, Evansville, WI 53536

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Adrian M Heydn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Adrian M Heydn.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Wynes is heard, they're prepared to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - Deputy K. Mezera, sworn  
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Wynes 

Comments by Attorney Steiner, let the record reflect that the witness has identified the defendant. 
State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Wynes objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Wynes requests a different date for the arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Adrian M Heydn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Charlotte Wynes appeared via video for Def.
     Court reviews Complaint with the Def. of all counts as a domestic abuse repeater; advised of maximum penalties.  Def. states understanding.
     Atty. Wynes notes Def. on a P.O. hold; does not address bond at this time.
     Def. asks if contact order may be lifted; has been contacted by S.B.N. via texts.
     Court does not modify the bond today; encouraged to contact his atty.
     Court concludes at 1:40 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:21 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Adrian Heydn appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond. State requests a $2,500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with SBN. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a $2,500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with SBN. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant shall have no contact with SBN.
